The claim has been shared more than 300: 2020, indicating its widespread circulation on social media platforms.
The claim states that a new law has been: reserving businesses 100% for Swaziland citizens only from October 1, 2020. This specific information is mentioned in the post.
The claim mentions that businesses such: mobile phone shops, and cleaning services will be reserved for citizens or companies wholly owned by citizens, providing specific examples of the types of businesses affected.
The government of Eswatini: through the Minister of Commerce, Industry and Trade, has officially denied the existence of such a law, calling the rumors malicious and damaging. The government's statement clarifies that while certain businesses are reserved for Emaswati citizens, there is no new law suggesting a complete reservation of businesses for citizens.
